Thank you for your time in the meeting. 

I have reviewed the matter with our legal department, and unfortunately, they have declined the request. They stated that it is not permitted to change any part of the contract, as this is an official agreement for all Sunaidi exhibitions. 

 

However, I can provide an official email under the name of Sunaidi stating that the Al Faisaliah Hotel has fire insurance coverage.

		Subject: Zoom Meeting Request to Discuss Contract

		 

		CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

		Dear Zainab,

		 

		I hope this message finds you well.

		 

		Ms. Ferial, the General Manager, and I would like to schedule a Zoom meeting with you tomorrow, Monday, January 12, 2025, at 11:00 AM to discuss the contract and the clause amendment.

		 

		Please confirm if this time works for you.

		 

		Thank you for your time and attention.

		 

		Best regards,

		Sarah

			Hello Sarah,

			 

			Since the contract is between us and Al Sunaidi, we will need the contract to reflect the terms clearly that in case of any damages from fire or so this will be part of your agreement with the venue.

			 

			Please if you can amend and share it at the earliest.

			 

			Best regards,

			 

			 

ZAINAB ALHALWACHI​​​​

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

				Dear Zainab,

				 

				I hope this email finds you well.

				 

				To clarify, by “sales order,” I mean that once the contract is signed, the sales order will be sent from our side, it has the bank details and allows payment to be processed.

				 

				Regarding the requested change to the contract clause, please note that the hall and the entire hotel are fully insured according to the regulations and instructions set by Civil Defense when the hotel was licensed to rent the hall for events. Therefore, as per the contract between Sunaidi Expo and Al Faisaliah Hotel, the hotel is responsible for any damage caused by fire, God forbid.

					From: sarah.albishri <sarah.albishri@sunaidiexpo.com>

					To: Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com>, Zainab AlHalwachi <Zainab.AlHalwachi@chalhoub.com>, Ayesha Alshamsi <Ayesha.Alshamsi@chalhoub.com>
					Cc: Nina Rapacioli <nina@akanacollective.com>, Alexandra Westmacott <alexandra@akanacollective.com>, Luchina Akhmad <luchina@akanacollective.com>

					تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

					Dear Piya, 

					 

					Thank you for your message. 

					 

					While we do offer empty spaces for custom booth construction, please note that your current selection is in a central location, with neighboring exhibitors on both sides. As a result, your booth will only be accessible from one open side.

					 

					I would like to suggest an alternative: relocating to space A-45. This location is more prominent, positioned at the front of the exhibition, and offers the advantage of being isolated, with no adjacent exhibitors, allowing for greater visibility and a more distinctive presence.

					From: sarah.albishri <sarah.albishri@sunaidiexpo.com>
					Date: Tuesday, 17 December 2024 at 5:53 pm
					To: Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com>, Zainab AlHalwachi <Zainab.AlHalwachi@chalhoub.com>, Ayesha Alshamsi <Ayesha.Alshamsi@chalhoub.com>
					Cc: Nina Rapacioli <nina@akanacollective.com>, Alexandra Westmacott <alexandra@akanacollective.com>, Luchina Akhmad <luchina@akanacollective.com>
					Subject: Re: Contract and Exhibition Details for Maison Chic 2025

					Hi Piya,

					 

					*	Your space is 3m x 4m 

					 

					You may begin setting up your stand from February 1, 2025.

					What time do we need to be complete by?

					 

					*	We prefer that you finish setting up your booth by the end of the day on February 2, but you can also complete it on the morning of February 3.

					 

					Regarding the permit, we have the exhibition permit, so you don’t need any permit yourself. Noted, do you have a permit for suppliers who are building for access to the space?

					 

					*	Yes, we issue visas for workers. However, we recommend you consider taking a booth from us, as shipping and construction costs may be high.

					 

					*	If you’d like, I can put you in direct contact with operations team in case you want to hire workers from them to help you build your stand.

					 

					Best regards, 

					Sarah 

					On 12/16/2024 4:54 PM +03 Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com> wrote:

					*	Regarding the permit, we have the exhibition permit, so you don't need any permit yourself Noted, do you have a permit for suppliers who are building for access of the space?

					From: sarah.albishri <sarah.albishri@sunaidiexpo.com>
					Date: Monday, 16 December 2024 at 4:52 PM
					To: Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com>
					Cc: Nina Rapacioli <nina@akanacollective.com>, Alexandra Westmacott <alexandra@akanacollective.com>, Zainab AlHalwachi <Zainab.AlHalwachi@chalhoub.com>, Luchina Akhmad <luchina@akanacollective.com>
					Subject: Contract and Exhibition Details for Maison Chic 2025

					Hello Piya, 

					 

					I hope this email finds you well.

					 

					Please find attached the contract for your participation in Maison Chic 2025. Below are the key details regarding your exhibition space:

					*	Your allocated space is 12 Sqm.

					*	 The maximum allowable height for your booth is 4 meters.

					*	We rent empty space only, which includes electricity and registration fees.

					*	 You may begin setting up your stand from February 1, 2025.

					*	Regarding the permit, we have the exhibition permit, so you don't need any permit yourself
					*	The electricity and wi-fi fees are included in the package.

					 

					 

					The Maison Chic exhibition will be held from February 3-6, 2025,

					and the event hours will be from 4:00 PM to 11:00 PM.

					 

					Should you have any further questions or need assistance, please feel free to reach out.

					 

					Best regards,

					On 12/16/2024 2:40 PM +03 Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com> wrote:

					Subject: Re: Contract and Exhibition Details for Maison Chic 2025
					Hi Piya,
					 
					*	Your space is 3m x 4m 
					 
					You may begin setting up your stand from February 1, 2025.
					What time do we need to be complete by?
					 
					*	We prefer that you finish setting up your booth by the end of the day on February 2, but you can also complete it on the morning of February 3.
					 
					Regarding the permit, we have the exhibition permit, so you don’t need any permit yourself. Noted, do you have a permit for suppliers who are building for access to the space?
					 
					*	Yes, we issue visas for workers. However, we recommend you consider taking a booth from us, as shipping and construction costs may be high.
					 
					*	If you’d like, I can put you in direct contact with operations team in case you want to hire workers from them to help you build your stand.
					 
					Best regards, 
					Sarah 
					On 12/16/2024 4:54 PM +03 Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com> wrote:

					Please find my comments next to yours in green below:
					*	Your allocated space is 12 Sqm. Please confirm this is 3m x 4m 
					*	The maximum allowable height for your booth is 4 meters. Noted
					*	We rent empty space only, which includes electricity and registration fees. Noted
					*	You may begin setting up your stand from February 1, 2025.

lhoub.com>, Luchina Akhmad <luchina@akanacollective.com>
					Subject: Contract and Exhibition Details for Maison Chic 2025
					Hello Piya, 
					 
					I hope this email finds you well.
					 
					Please find attached the contract for your participation in Maison Chic 2025. Below are the key details regarding your exhibition space:
					*	Your allocated space is 12 Sqm.
					*	 The maximum allowable height for your booth is 4 meters.
					*	We rent empty space only, which includes electricity and registration fees.
					*	 You may begin setting up your stand from February 1, 2025.
					*	Regarding the permit, we have the exhibition permit, so you don't need any permit yourself
					*	The electricity and wi-fi fees are included in the package.
					 
					 
					The Maison Chic exhibition will be held from February 3-6, 2025,
					and the event hours will be from 4:00 PM to 11:00 PM.
					 
					Should you have any further questions or need assistance, please feel free to reach out.
					 
					Best regards,
					On 12/16/2024 2:40 PM +03 Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com> wrote:
					 
					 
					Hi Sarah, 
					 
					Hope you are well, lovely to connect. 
					 
					*	Please do share the participation contract
					*	Please do confirm the size of the stand is 3m x 4m – 12sqm
					*	Please do share the restrictions on build and stand design – are there any restrictions on the height? Walls closing up the space? Weight constraints etc? Are there rigging points?
					*	Will you be sharing an empty space for us to build on or will there be an existing flooring / walls etc
					*	Please confirm installation days and timings 
					*	Please confirm event timings on the 3rd – 6th 
					*	Please confirm permit requirements – what do you require from our suppliers for permits?

		Dear Zainab,

		 

		I hope this message finds you well.

		 

		Ms. Ferial, the General Manager, and I would like to schedule a Zoom meeting with you tomorrow, Monday, January 12, 2025, at 11:00 AM to discuss the contract and the clause amendment.

		 

		Please confirm if this time works for you.

		 

		Thank you for your time and attention.

		 

		Best regards,

		Sarah

			Hello Sarah,

			 

			Since the contract is between us and Al Sunaidi, we will need the contract to reflect the terms clearly that in case of any damages from fire or so this will be part of your agreement with the venue.

			 

			Please if you can amend and share it at the earliest.

			 

			Best regards,

			 

			 

ZAINAB ALHALWACHI​​​​

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

			Dear Zainab,

			 

			Thank you for your communication.

			 

			There is no need to amend the contract, as the hall and the entire hotel are fully insured in accordance with the regulations and instructions set by the Civil Defence when the hotel was granted the license to rent the hall for events.

			 

			Therefore, according to the contract between Al-Sunidi Expo and the esteemed Al-Faisaliah Hotel, they are responsible for any damage resulting from a fire.

			 

			If you have any further questions or require additional information, please feel free to contact us.

			 

			Best regards

			 

			Sarah,

				Dear Zainab,

				 

				I hope this email finds you well.

				 

				To clarify, by “sales order,” I mean that once the contract is signed, the sales order will be sent from our side, it has the bank details and allows payment to be processed.

				 

				Regarding the requested change to the contract clause, please note that the hall and the entire hotel are fully insured according to the regulations and instructions set by Civil Defense when the hotel was licensed to rent the hall for events. Therefore, as per the contract between Sunaidi Expo and Al Faisaliah Hotel, the hotel is responsible for any damage caused by fire, God forbid.

				 

				Please feel free to reach out if you need any further clarification.

				 

				Best regards,

				Sarah

				 

					On 01/02/2025 11:32 AM +03 Zainab AlHalwachi <zainab.alhalwachi@chalhoub.com <mailto:zainab.alhalwachi@chalhoub.com> > wrote:

					For the sales order @Nesma Shahin <mailto:Nesma.Shahin@chalhoub.com>  from the team will share the required documents for the supplier creation and PO.

					 

					Regarding the agreement, I’ve replied on the other thread with the legal team.

					 

					Best regards,

					 

					 

ZAINAB ALHALWACHI​​​​

DUBAI

chunks.text:
While we do offer empty spaces for custom booth construction, please note that your current selection is in a central location, with neighboring exhibitors on both sides. As a result, your booth will only be accessible from one open side.

					 

					I would like to suggest an alternative: relocating to space A-45. This location is more prominent, positioned at the front of the exhibition, and offers the advantage of being isolated, with no adjacent exhibitors, allowing for greater visibility and a more distinctive presence.

					 

					Please feel free to reach out if you would like to discuss this option further.

					 

					Best regards,

					Sarah

					On 12/19/2024 12:21 PM +03 Piya Paul <piya@akanacollective.com> wrote:

					 

					 

					Hi Sarah,

					 

					What do you mean it’s open form one side? I thought we were given an empty space to build on?

					 

					Looping in @Zainab AlHalwachi <mailto:Zainab.AlHalwachi@chalhoub.com>  for the contract.

					 

					Warm Regards,

					Piya Paul 

					 

					Event Director
